{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3549789,"name":"kuzey","username":"kuzeyatay","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/59ef9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T21:09:57.131Z","cooked":"

Hi, i am trying to make our chassis(swerve) drive and align to the april tags on the reef and the human loading zone but i am confused to select a method. as far as i know i can use pathplanner(on the fly) use limelight tx and ty pose to drive to the target, make the chassis drive to a pose or take the difference between the limelights tag pose and our pose and feed the difference to a pid controller. can someone lead me on this or share an example code. i am using advantage kits neo swerve library and have two limelights. one at the bottom(LL4) and one at the top(LL3) for aligning both to the reef and the human loading zone.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T21:09:57.131Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":124.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494539,"topic_slug":"drive-to-tag-vs-drive-to-pose","display_username":"kuzey","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61536,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/drive-to-tag-vs-drive-to-pose/494539/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3549804,"name":"Leo & Mali","username":"SeansCoolerFriend","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seanscoolerfriend/{size}/232971_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T21:29:26.766Z","cooked":"

Hi there! Limelight on the fly path generation is also what we are utilizing this year.

1.) So, essentially, on-the-fly path generation will create a spline curve that will also rotate the robot (because it can estimate current robot pose), meaning you don’t actually have to adjust for angle.

2.) We are using a calculation we found on the limelight documentation page in order to generate our paths to the reef. (here it is: Estimating Distance | Limelight Documentation)

To use the calculation, you will need to mount your limelight in a position where it will not move, and then record some constants like your limelight’s height above the ground and angle from the ground, this image is helpful if you want to get an idea of what those constants are.

Just to let you know, we are using CTRE generated swerve code for krakens, so our code may look different from yours but if you’d like to look at our limelight subsystem, it should be pretty similar to what you are trying to achieve here.

here’s our github:

github.com

GitHub - warroboticss/Fluke2025: our super cool! absolute fluke!

our super cool! absolute fluke!

Good luck, and let me know if you have any questions!
